content.description: Climb past 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor over slopey holds. The rock is crumbly in places, but this route should improve with more cleaning. Not recommended for the novice 5.7 leader.
content.protection:
4 quickdraws and something for the 2 bolt anchor (with chains).

This climb shares an anchor with

River Rats

.
content.location:
This route starts 30' left (downhill) from

Orange You Glad

.

content.description:
Rocks for Jocks climbs the chimney right of

Hippie Cheerleaders

for 4 well-spaced bolts.  This climb gets the coveted "skull and crossbones" in the guidebook and will only be enjoyable for a confident 5.10 leader.  The crux is bulging, reachy, and closer to 5.10.  Not to mention, you might break your ankles if you blow it.  Does it sound like fun yet?  Did I mention the rat droppings?

At the third bolt, head left to join the nearby line and anchors.
content.location: It is the fifth route from the left of the wall....

content.description: Follow 5 bolts up the arete to a ledge with a two bolt anchor. The rock is a bit suspect but more traffic should help that. Not recommended for a novice 5.7 leader.
content.protection:
5 quickdraws and something for the two bolt anchor.

This route shares its anchors with

Turtle Head

.

content.description: Follow well-spaced bolts up a groove covered in orange lichen. Pass 6 bolts to the base of a separate detached block (see photo). From the base of the detached block, clip three more bolts over vertical or slightly overhanging ground on large holds. The rock is suspect for the entire route! Not recommended for a novice 5.7 leader.
content.protection: 9 quickdraws and something for the two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the last bolted line (as you go uphill) on the Poudre Face. The orange lichen groove makes it hard to miss this one.

content.description:
I gave this one an extra star, since your will need to place some gear.  Start just right of

B.A.H.

Clip a couple bolts on your way to a fun crack system.  A few small to medium cam placements will lead you to a final bolt and the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a fistful of cams to 2 inches....

content.description: Loyalist is not the best route here but is worth climbing once.  Follow non-descript rock past 5 bolts to a set of anchors.
content.location: This is the last route on the right.

content.description: Thin face climbing and side pulls around an arete.  The crux is located just past a bulge after a good rest.  The moves aren't as hard as figuring out where to go.
content.location:
This climbs the arete uphill from

Crossbow

.

content.description: This has weaving but otherwise straightforward face climbing.
content.location:
This is the next route right of

Cheerleaders Gone Hippie

.

content.description: This is a fun outing through a handful of bulges on thin crimps. There is one hold on the first bulge that looks like it could break off at any minute.
content.location:
This is just to the left of

B.A.H.

content.description: A slopey start leads to an offwidth-style crux - an unusual move.
content.location:
This is just right of

Check Your Head

and

Check Your Six

.

content.description:
This would be a 4 star route, if the climbing did not degrade on "

Check Your Head

".  Follow very thin moves along a crack system to a roof finish that joins "

Check Your Head

" 5.10b/c.
content.protection:
5 bolts to the finish on

Head

....
content.location:
It is a direct start to

Check Your Head

....

content.description: Lieback up an intermittent seam, eventually cranking over it. There are several hard spots and also a few rests.
content.location: This is the first route encountered on the main trail. There is one bolted line lower on the ridge.

content.description:
The crux is on the lower half of the climb. Climb to the left side of the bolt line. The climbing gets eaiser at the top.

Eds. note two entries for this route have been combined into one entry to avoid problems with duplication.
content.location:
This route is located between #53 and #54 in the The Palace Guide or one route climber's left of

Creepy

.

This lies in between

Flail

and

Creepy

.

content.description: Big holds, a few bombers, take you over a bulge or two. The crux may be the final, thinner moves to the anchor on lead.
content.location:
Left of

Palace Guard

, this is a partially bolted crack.
